books.title: The Mysterious Affair at Styles
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A fastidious Belgian detective solves the mystery of a murder in an English country manor.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: Memoirs of a Revolutionist
books.author: Peter Kropotkin
books.summary: A Russian revolutionary tells of his life from early childhood, his adventures as a geographer, and how he turned into an anarcho-communist.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: The adventures of a young boy and his friend, an escaped slave, on the Mississippi river in the Antebellum South.

books.title: Mike
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s adventures in public school are filled with cricket, colorful characters, and a great deal of fun at the expense of authoritarian school masters.

books.title: Short Plays
books.author: J. M. Synge
books.summary: A collection of three short plays by J. M. Synge.

books.title: Jurgen
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: Jurgen, a pawnbroker and “monstrous clever fellow,” is sent on a witty and parodic magical journey in search of true love.

books.title: Those Barren Leaves
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: An aristocrat summons a group of “intelligentsia” to vacation in her Italian mansion.

books.title: The Three Impostors
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: Two flâneurs in Victorian London get caught up with the members of a secret society and their search for a rare Roman coin.

books.title: Up from Slavery
books.author: Booker T. Washington
books.summary: The autobiography of Booker T. Washington, former slave and founder of the Tuskegee Institute.

books.title: Lady Audley’s Secret
books.author: M. E. Braddon
books.summary: When his friend disappears suddenly in mysterious circumstances, a young, idle barrister feels forced to investigate, even at the peril of destroying the happiness of his beloved uncle.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.

books.title: A Voice from the South
books.author: Anna Julia Cooper
books.summary: A Black woman from the American South philosophizes on various subjects.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: John Keats
books.summary: A collection of John Keats’ published poems, and a selection of unpublished fragments and posthumous verse.

books.title: The Coming of Bill
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A domineering author of books on eugenics and hygiene makes a match between her niece and an idle artist, intending them to raise a son according to her principles, regardless of the consequences.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: A collection of short stories by H. G. Wells in a variety of genres ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of P. G. Wodehouse’s short fiction.

books.title: The Pursuit of God
books.author: A. W. Tozer
books.summary: A. W. Tozer’s classic work on Christian living, containing practical advice for those who wish to know God, not simply know about Him.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.
